intro: Phrygilanthus aphyllus f. luteus, commonly known as the yellow-flowered phrygilanthus, is a unique plant characterized by its lack of leaves and its striking yellow flowers. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to specific regions in Africa. The plant exhibits a succulent stem that stores water, adapting to arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a soft, fuzzy appearance. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
